claim: If Alexis had been deployed exclusively as a winger in every league match he played, he would have produced the highest number of accurate crosses among Alexis, Ariel Borysiuk, and Arouna Kone.
extra_info: player who perform best in crossing actions refers to MAX(crossing);

content.text:
This claim describes a hypothetical "what if" scenario: "If Alexis had been deployed exclusively as a winger in every league match he played, he would have produced the highest number of accurate crosses..."

This is a counterfactual claim. It asks about what *would have happened* under a hypothetical condition (being deployed exclusively as a winger), not what actually happened. The database only records what actually occurred, not what would have happened under different deployment scenarios.

Per the classification rules, counterfactual claims must always be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO.

```json
{"label": "NOT ENOUGH INFO", "reasoning": "This is a counterfactual claim. It uses 'If Alexis had been deployed exclusively as a winger... he would have produced...' which describes a hypothetical scenario that cannot be verified from a database that only records what actually happened."}
```
